Was soll ich dazu sagen? Gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis. Und das Spiel an sich? Einfach Klasse. Die (immer noch) riesen Community hinter dem Spiel ist Super, man muss nie lange warten um in ein Spiel zu kommen und man kommt nicht als Noob mit Profis in eine Runde.

Fazit:
Kauft es euch, wenn Ihr FPS shooter mögt, denn dieses Spiel muss unbedingt in eure Sammlung.

It's the best game in the world,i love it!

Okay so hear me out. I love the general game mechanics: the tactical side of it as well as the skill side of it. It's really fun to play with a team and communicate as a real 'operations team'. But here is one of the problems already. The chance that you come across a team with 4 other players that all use their mic properly (not just screaming cyka every 2 seconds) is sooo small. It barely happens, especially in lower ranks like silver (where you could get stuck for a while). Also the non-prime experience sucks. I have two friends who don't have prime and I can asure you, I had to report a lot of people in the past week. And I know I could be wrong, that the other persons weren't hacking, but I'm pretty sure because I already received 4 notifications that a player I reported got banned for hacking.
Another negative point about the game is the fact that 5v5 is only available in competitive mode. I don't think casual mode wouldn't be that difficult to add in but this is again a perfect example of Valve completely ignoring their community's voice.

So I there are many things I hate about CS:GO and you're probably hesitating if you would install it. Even tough there are all these things i dislike about the game, I still have like 550+ hours on it. I just love the format of the game and I don't think these negative points are negative enough to prevent me from playing more so just install it, get a bit used to the game and I still think you will enjoy it.
